creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: busy pedestrian street in evening; three large lanterns, red and white, with black Japanese text; other signs and lights; shops with curtains over doorways; figures walking including woman in red kimono with a pink bundle with child, both seen from back, in LLQ, and young woman in purple kimono and green jacket in LRQ
inscription: left, in maroon: 昭和十三年　夜の東京　新宿 {Shōwa jūsannen saku, Yoru no Tokyo, Shinjuku} | LLC, printed in grey: Sinjukhu | LRC, in pencil: Toshi Yoshida
markings: LLC, red artist\'s seal: 吉田{Yoshida}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Tokyo at Night (Yoru no Tōkyō 夜の東京)
title: Shinjuku
